revised_title: Effects of Accelerated Growth on Behaviour and Nervous Activity in Rats
tldr: The study investigates the effects of accelerated growth on the behavior and nervous activity of rats. Rats that experienced rapid growth showed more active and inquisitive behavior, as well as quicker learning compared to their slower-growing littermates. The research suggests that nutritional variables may play a role in the correlation between physical and mental development in children, and that faster-growing children may display greater mental activity and learning abilities.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Animal Behavior
